newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end up, new scrip gains.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end up, new scrip gains.

text.p: Dhaka stocks ended up in a continued market rally and brokers said there had been slight corrections in some blue chip shares.
Brokers said the 100-taka share of Kay & Que (Bd) Ltd made a flying start in its debut trading at 1,903 taka on a volume of 2,050 shares.

Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) all-share price index rose 47.70 points or 3.02 percent at 1,622.26 on a turnover of 283.8 million taka. Of the 111 issues traded, 78 ended up, 31 closed down and five unchanged.
Broker Moshtaque Ahmed said there had been "slight correction" in the market with some blue chip cement scrips losing prices.
Reckitt & Colman lost 33.66 taka to 301.13, Bata Shoe Company gained 61.47 to 234.21 and Cofidence Cement fell 290.52 to 1,437.61. ($1 = 42.30 taka)
